title: Ekko Balance?!
body:
Riot, are you trying to say Ekko was a little broken?  He was obscenely broken.  If the solution to dealing with him is to learn how to play against him, then fine.  But while I have him pegged (usually), most of the players at my Elo can't help but feed him.  I know you're concerned about the state of professional play, but lower-level play is suffering because of this guy.

So what do you do?  You concede his brokenness (kind of) and then give him a slap on the wrist?  You didn't even touch one of base damages or AP ratios.  And if you're worried about his early game, then leave all that the same and just nerf his mid and high ability levels.  AND GIVE HIS ULTIMATE A MANA COST.  HE HAS A FREE HEAL THAT REWARDS HIM FOR GOING WAY IN OVER HIS HEAD.  The amount of freedom he has to dive and tear up back lines with relatively little risk is just insane.

replies.body: Chill bro with the rant. If you read the boards you'd know that Ekko will be getting a mana cost on his ulti at 100 mana. The only reason it isn't is because of some code/game problem stuff that they couldnt figure out. I mean, if you want to talk about a "safe" assassin, talk about Zed... Which no one talks about.

You're like 2 months late bro. The Zed QQ train departed a while ago.
I feel like ekko is safer than zed honestly. And more utility too.
both of them are still pretty safe. ekko beats zed in utility though
I haven't seen but 2 zeds played since his ult got nerfed. So refreshing.

Thenâ€¦ my bad for missing that.  Like honestly I think Ekko has a lot of potential to be a very well balanced champ, but right now he's all over the place with the way his kit works.  It's just kind of stupid.  I'm not saying they need to nerf him into the ground either, but besides the regular amount of time it takes for people to adjust to new champions, I think he could use some refocusing in his kit, and some of that could definitely include a bigger nerf than a slight mana cost increase and more visibility on something that wasn't that hard to begin with.

Like seriously, I think they shouldn't have nerfed the visibility on his w and ult because now you'd have to be really stupid to get caught in them.  That's not even playable, and it's not what will make him a healthy champ.  I think they should change the w and ult to back where they were and instead cut some of his damage (and maybe retweak how one of his passives works).  I would rehash the mana cost on the ult, but we already discussed that.

I agree he needs tweaks but is balancable. Main thing about his ult I don't like is that it is always following him around. If he had to activate it once to get the shadow follow him around, then had a window of time to reactivate it I would really like him. It would mean he had to actually plan and use it smartly rather then the current "oops" reaction ult. 

Of course this change only actually affects the stupid ekkos, but I could accept getting outplayed by a smart ekko more than an idiot always getting away.
If you want, this is how I want Ekko. [Link](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/a8225f3f-what-i-want-on-ekko)
so why don't they disable him till he's more balanced ?

Honestly, I used to think Ekko was actually OP. But after playing a few games against and with Ekko, I learned how to play against him. I think the deal with Ekko QQ was people not really learning how to play against him, but after a while, I saw the Ekko QQ threads die down. And, no, I am not an Ekko main. I'm a Rumble main. So don't accuse me of defending my main.

I'm actually straight up going to agree with this. I still think his ult is a little overloaded for how much it provides with 0 mana but other than that it's pretty straightforward most of the time. Dont let the second part of his q hit you, stay out of the w bubble, watch out for his E's, Keep an eye on the time clone. He can definitely bait you on to his clone for a kill, but that's also you not thinking ahead.

Yeah, like I said in my original post, I know how to fight Ekko, but other people don't, and his team fight potential is still stupid.  People don't understand that you pretty much have to either chunk him or cc him hard before the fight.  And the fact is, you really shouldn't.  He should be squishy, and not have a ridiculous amount of mobility AND heal AND damage all in one for free.  Like that's the biggest thing that irritates me.

You aren't exactly contributing anything here.  Just another generic, "Nerf X champion" thread.  If you want to look at elo specifically, I remember Tryndamere and Katarina being significantly more annoying, with a streak of Cho'Gath oppression awhile back.

That's something I've realized just by responding to some comments on this thread.  I think it's become more of an issue of "this champion is what makes bronze/silver torture".  On the other hand, that still doesn't justify him being too strong even in low elo games just because people don't know how to fight him.

Katarina has been nerfed really hard multiple times over the past few patches, and while it does mean she has to work much harder for her pentakills, she is still very capable of carrying solo queue games, especially at low elos.  So if she isn't exempt from that kind of treatment, then why should Ekko be?  If it's just that they need more time to observe him, I'm fine with that, but I felt this should be said.  His nerf was really stupid.

The thing about Katarina, though, is that she was seeing play in high levels as well.  Her nerfs I feel were geared more towards her being abused there, rather then her being abused in lower levels of play.  

As for Ekko, I feel he is fine.  He is manageable if you know how to deal with him.  For your elo I feel it will just take awhile longer to learn how to deal with him.  Every elo has its problem champions, so nerfing ones because they are problems in specific areas isn't a good decision for balancing.  Buffing/nerfing is best done if its for high level of play mainly because those players are the ones who can easily turn free extra power into a win.

*sigh* Are we STILL having this conversation? There's a nerf to his Q AND a mana cost on his ult on the PBE. Even though his winrate is already under 50%. He already doesn't have a lot of success in tearing up back lines in full-blown teamfights. His damage falls off in the late game, and the only reason he's a threat in the mid game is that stacking Lich Bane and Luden's enhances his burst beyond its normally mediocre levels (and he's NOT the only champ who does this). I'm just kind of whatever about it all at this point. I can't believe people are still freaking out about him. He is fun, but unbelievably overrated.
Ekko's kit is fine, all it needs is some number tuning.

"obscenely broken" is way overstated. Despite all the complaints people have, I actually think he has better tradeoffs then most assassins. 
He shouldn't win lane unlike most assassins.
a lot of his damage is conditional (second part of timewinder and 3 hits for passive) unlike most assassins.
he has wave clear, but it costs a lot of mana (unlike zed)
all these tradeoffs for the lategame utility of parallel convergence (which has a huge windup time to where it's hard to hit unless it's coming from fog of war) and the damage on his ultimate, which relies on him not using it to escape, and his enemies grouping up around the spot that is clearly marked to be a danger area. 
After they give his ult a mana cost, my opinion is that he will be one of the better-balanced assassins in the game.

People misusing the term broken again.

Excellent
well he did break time tho

...the great majority of his garbage happens in one of two mostly avoidable situations.

1. He gets his third passive proc. This is huge. Enormous movespeed swing and a spell's worth of damage. But you DID just eat any combination of three spells and autoattacks. When you have two stacks, you are in SERIOUS danger. People respect Annie when she has her stun up, but they don't treat Ekko the same way yet. That's wrong, and that gets punished.

2. You eat the shield stun. Also huge. HP shield with over a two second stun. That can be gg on a squishy easily. But his wind-up is a distinct "baseball swing," a loud chime plays when he's setting up, and the area the shield stun hits is visible a moment before it lands. If Ekko can get to it, it is not okay to be there. Again, many people don't respect this. Don't stand in Dark Matter or Null Sphere, don't stand in that.

I've played a considerable amount of Ekko and the majority of my kills are from people simply not respecting any part of the kit. The majority of my deaths are from R denial via CC, and burst damage.

I feel like Ekko's strong because he's *complicated.* People didn't bother to learn what he does and how he does it, when they do know they don't respect it like they do for established champions (my favorite example is Annie).

Like a lot of champions, there are criteria that must be met in most circumstances to engage Ekko successfully. If Brand lands his stun Q, you're in trouble. If Ahri lands Charm, you're in trouble. Understand Ekko's power spikes are his third passive stack and the shield stun and things will go a lot more smoothly.

edit: Timewinder (Q) also hits *way* harder returning to Ekko than going out.

This is exactly what I'm saying.  People are giving me crap because I need to "learn to fight him" or something stupid like that.  I know how to fight him.  The morons I get stuck with in game don't.  That's what pisses me off.
He isn't really obscenely broken. He had a bit too much probably but he was in no way as broken as you say he was
Dodge obvious, slow moving abilities like any competent player?!
"Dodge obvious, slow moving abilities that he unloads in your face after dashing to you? Like any player fighting an Ekko?"

How exactly does he unload his ultimate in your face? Lol.  He is an assassin.  He is supposed to be bursty.  Pick something that is more bursty or something that can tank the burst.  For example, take a LB mid against Ekko and watch the Ekko QQ while you go in, deal a ton of damage and then get back out almost instantly.
The problem is not the champion, the problem is people not knowing how to play against the champion.
More or less I was referring to his Q, and to a moderately more accurate W.

The thing I hate is that in competitive play he's played Jungle/Top/Mid as a Bruiser/Assassin. His kit's so stuffed with effects he can flex into a ton of different roles, probably as many as champs who don't excel at all of the roles they flex into like Kayle.
Kayle can literally play ANY role. Ekko can't play botlane at all.

Oh stop.

Ekko just requires you to play better.  He has (admittidley) a heavy kit with lots of options, unless he is absolutely useless he will always be strong.  Instead of complaining about it learn to play against him.  And wait for everyone else to learn to play against him.
I already told you I know how to fight him.  The idiots I play with don't.
OP doesnt look @winrates i guess...
Its stupid because he can build tanky and still do dmg.

Not really :/
I mean, he can provide massive amounts of cc, but not really do damage with it.
yeah he can provide a decent amount of dmg plus his cc equals broken

no.

By your logic {{champion:90}} is broken
Mal doesn't have a dash plus another dash that can hop over walls.
You never said anything about that in your original comment

Getting his entire combo off (assuming you have no AP) is about 1000 damage at level 18.
And that is assuming that timewinder heads back, and all his abilites, including passive, hits, which is extremely unlikely considering the fact that his primary source of damage is easily telegraphed.
Also, nothing in his kit synergises at all with being a tank, considering he has pretty low base armor and MR.
The best you can do with Ekko is build half tank, with some AP included (See {{item:3151}}) and hope that you can hit your entire combo off  when you have easy attacks to dodge, and the only {{champion:86}}teed hit is your e, which by the way teleports you to the enemy, and by that extent, the team in teamfights.

I find that his R ap ratio is a bit too high right now. I do not like how it can be used to escape from a bad situation or deal massive damage. At least reduce the ratio to 1, which is still pretty high. IT CAN'T EVEN BE INTERRUPTED like Death Lotus which also makes slapping a huge amount of damage onto it too strong.

Another idea is having the ap ratio scale throughout the game. It could start at .9 at rank 1, 1.0 at rank 2 and 1.1 at rank 3.

*Edit: How about a ring around Ekko's clone that shows the area in which his ult is going to apply damage?
I dont mind his damage, his movespeed is too high for the core itmes he gets and his mobility.
[http://www.surrenderat20.net](http://www.surrenderat20.net/2015/06/69-pbe-update.html#bal1)

There's like fifteen champions that people can't help but feed in low elo, Ekko's the least oppressive of them. And his ult already has a mana cost on PBE. _And_ nobody is rewarded for diving in recklessly, one CC skill and one decent damage dealer will kill him in seconds since he can't ult while so much as CC'd.

His kit is really, really bad and unfocused. To nerf him would make him unplayable in high level play. you can't use your W effectively outside of teamfights against players with half a brain. His dash isn't very long without a target, and it doesn't hit hard enough to make anything really count without Luden's and Lich bane. His Q isn't that fantastic, due to the long time it takes before it turns around, you just walk out of it before it does the majority of its damage. His ult is a hot subject, but I'd say giving it a manacost is a really, really bad idea. His lack of burst damage makes it a really lackluster escape for an assassin, and against anyone else with any mobility, he gets screwed. 

Leave him be, don't ban him, learn how to play against him. He is a skillshot champ, play against him like you would Diana.

I do.  I told you in my post that I know how to fight him, but bronzies don't.  I always end up fighting stupid fed Ekko's because of how his kit worksâ€¦ I guess now I'm just making the case that he's like Katâ€¦ who just got nerfedâ€¦ needlessly imhoâ€¦ and that's coming from a guy who hates Katarina.
